titlestmt.titleproper: George W.P. Hunt and the Constitution of Arizona, ca. 1915-1920
Hunt, (George W.P.) and the Constitution of Arizona,
titlestmt.author: Processed by Staff.

profiledesc.creation: Inventory encoded in Oxygen XML editor by Steven Burg. November 16, 2015

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: George W.P. Hunt and the Constitution of Arizona, ca. 1915-1920
did.abstract: George W.P. Hunt was an Arizona politician and served as President of the Arizona Constitutional Convention in 1910. This collection consists of a typescript, by Estelle Lutrell and documents the story of the creation of the Arizona Constitution in 1910.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: George W.P. Hunt and the Constitution of Arizona (AZ 081). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George W.P. Hunt, Arizona politician; President of the Arizona Constitutional Convention, 1910, and Governor of Arizona, 1912-1919, 1923- 1929, and 1931-1933.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized as a chronological narrative.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript, by Estelle Lutrell; story of the creation of the Arizona Constitution in 1910.

item.persname: Hunt, George W. P. (George Wylie Paul), 1859-1934.
